marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Reports Retail Sales Growth in March 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that retail sales in Indonesia grew 9.9% month‑on‑month and 9.3% year‑on‑year in March 2024 (versus February 2024: 1.7% month‑on‑month and 6.4% year‑on‑year), supported by increased consumer activity during Ramadan, preparation for Idulfitri, and discount programs. Bank Indonesia forecasts retail sales in April 2024 to grow 3.3% month‑on‑month and 0.1% year‑on‑year.

marketNews.title: Credit Growth Projection for 2024 by Ryan Kiryanto
marketNews.content: Senior Economist and Associate Faculty of the Indonesian Banking Development Institute, Ryan Kiryanto, projected that bank credit growth in 2024 will reach only 7‑10% year‑on‑year, lower than the industry target set by Bank Indonesia of 10‑12% year‑on‑year. He based his projection on the unfavourable global economic conditions, which will cause most banks to revise their targets downwards. Previously, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) revised its credit growth guidance from 11‑12% year‑on‑year to 10‑12% year‑on‑year, while Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) cut its guidance from 11‑12% year‑on‑year to 10‑11% year‑on‑year.

marketNews.title: OJK Reports 138 Upcoming Public Offerings with Indicative Value 54.33 Trillion Rupiah
marketNews.content: The Chief Executive of the Capital Market, Derivatives, and Carbon Exchange Supervision at OJK, Inarno Djajadi, said on Monday (13/5) that there are 138 pipeline public offerings with an indicative total value of 54.33 trillion rupiah. Among them, 80 companies plan IPOs with a total indicative value of 11.38 trillion rupiah and 11 rights issues with an indicative value of 5.64 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Plans Additional 50,000 Electric Motorbike Subsidy Units in 2024
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Electric Motorbike Industry Association, Budi Setiyadi, said the government plans to add a quota of 50,000 electric motorbike subsidy units in 2024 if the current subsidy quota has been fulfilled. In 2024, the subsidy quota for electric motorbikes is only 50,000 units, down from 600,000 units in 2023 due to low realization. As of Monday (13/5), the Ministry of Industry recorded that 15,109 electric motorbikes have been distributed to the public, 580 units are under verification, and 11,248 units are in the registration process.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Down 10% on Ex‑Date; Opportunity to Earn Minimum 5% Dividend per Year
tickerNews.content: The share price of Astra International (ASII) fell 9.75% to 4,580 rupiah per share in today's trading on Tuesday (14/5), which is the ex‑dividend date. Previously, ASII distributed a final dividend for fiscal year 2023 amounting to approximately 17 trillion rupiah or 421 rupiah per share, with a payment date of 30 May 2024. This indicates a final dividend yield of 8.3% based on the cum‑dividend price of 5,075 rupiah per share on Monday (13/5). In addition to the final dividend, ASII previously paid an interim dividend of about 4 trillion rupiah or 98 rupiah per share in October 2023. In total, ASII paid a dividend of 519 rupiah per share from the 2023 net profit, equivalent to a 62% dividend payout ratio. The chart shows that ASII's dividend payout ratio was stable at 40% before the pandemic (2017‑2019), while the lowest post‑2020 ratio was 48%. Net profit levels after the pandemic (since 2022) are also higher than pre‑pandemic levels. With today's price decline, ASII shares have weakened 18.9% year‑to‑date, driven by negative sentiment such as BYD's entry and weak automotive sales. Key Takeaway: We consider bottoming signs in car sales are needed before price recovery, but the current price offers an opportunity to collect ASII as a high‑dividend, consistent payer. Based on a conservative dividend assumption of 239 rupiah per share (as in 2021), the dividend yield would be 5.2% at the current price of 4,580 rupiah per share. This article was previously released in Stockbit Commentary.

tickerNews.title: ANTM: 2024 Gold Production Target Reduced by 20.7% YoY
tickerNews.content: ANTM's Corporate Secretary, Syarif Faisal Alkadrie, told Kontan that the company targets gold production of 958 kilograms in 2024, which is 20.7% lower than the 2023 realization of 1,208 kilograms. In 1Q24, ANTM produced 166 kilograms, reaching only 17.3% of the 2024 target. For 2024, ANTM plans an investment of 4.5 trillion rupiah, of which 1 trillion rupiah is allocated to mining exploration, 2 trillion rupiah to subsidiaries, and the remainder for routine investment.

tickerNews.title: BREN: 2024 Capex Allocation and Geothermal Capacity Expansion
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), Hendra Soetjipto Tan, said the company allocated a capex of 160 million US dollars for 2024. In 1Q24, BREN has absorbed about 13 million US dollars of capex for drilling activities at the Drajat asset. The 2024 capex will also be used for periodic well maintenance. Over the next two years, BREN plans to increase its geothermal capacity by 13.1% to reach 1,002 megawatts.

tickerNews.title: IMAS: Yadea Indonesia Plant Construction Worth $150 Million
tickerNews.content: The electric motor producer Yadea in Indonesia, PT Yadea Teknologi Indonesia, started building a plant worth 150 million US dollars in the Suryacipta industrial area, Karawang Regency, West Java. The plant, scheduled to operate in 2026, will be built on 37 hectares of land and have a production capacity of 3 million vehicles per year. The Yadea electric motorcycles will be distributed by Indomobil's subsidiary PT Indomobil Emotor Internasional.

tickerNews.title: TOTL: 2023 Dividend Yield Approx 8.5%
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2023 amounting to approximately 136.4 billion rupiah or about 40 rupiah per share. The cum‑dividend and payment date have not been announced. Based on TOTL's share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 472 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 8.5%.

tickerNews.title: MAHA: 2023 Dividend Yield Approx 5.4%
tickerNews.content: Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa (MAHA) will distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2023 of approximately 200 billion rupiah or 12 rupiah per share. The cum‑dividend will be on the regular and negotiation markets on 20 May 2024, with payment on 3 June 2024. Based on MAHA's share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 222 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 5.4%.

tickerNews.title: TPIA: Additional 2021 Dividend Yield Approx 0.06%
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) will distribute an additional cash dividend from fiscal year 2021 amounting to 30 million US dollars or 5.6 rupiah per share. The cum‑dividend will be on the regular and negotiation markets on 20 May 2024, with payment on 12 June 2024. Based on TPIA's share price on Tuesday (14/5) at 8,425 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is 0.06%.

tickerNews.title: BABP: Lippo Group Acquires 10% Stake in Bank MNC Internasional
tickerNews.content: Lippo group entity PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa purchased approximately 4.4 billion rupiah (10%) of shares of Bank MNC Internasional (BABP) from MNC Land (KPIG). The transaction was recorded in KSEI data on 8 May 2024. The share price for the BABP transaction was 126 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: KPIG: Purchases 10% Stake in NOBU
tickerNews.content: KPIG bought 747.8 million rupiah (10%) of shares of Bank Nationalnobu (NOBU) from PT Prima Cakrawala Sentosa. The transaction was recorded in KSEI data on 8 May 2024. The share price for the NOBU transaction was 749 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: NOBU: Shares Sold to KPIG
tickerNews.content: Bank Nationalnobu (NOBU) sold 747.8 million rupiah (10%) of its shares to KPIG. The transaction was recorded in KSEI data on 8 May 2024. The share price for the transaction was 749 rupiah per share.
